content.p: The School of Law offers a number of Executive Education and Continuing Professional Development (CPD) courses which will develop your practical and professional knowledge and skills. Our professional development opportunities are underpinned by our leading academic and professional expertise as well as our reputation for innovative course design and delivery. Recognising the growing importance of legal regulation in controlling public procurement, this programme offers a comprehensive grounding in the legal aspects of the subject. This course gives an in-depth understanding of international human rights standards and of the UN and regional systems that implement them. It has both theoretical and practical dimensions, with an emphasis on current issues. This 10 or 5-week residential course, runs twice a year. It is for recent graduate students or those in employment or others who wish to learn more about international human rights law for educational or career purposes. Law and Social Sciences building University of Nottingham University Park Nottingham, NG7 2RD
